answers.q: how do i change the spark plugs on a 1987 ford e359 7.5l
answers.a: Unrelated to food additive E359; E359 is ammonium adipate, a salt of adipic acid used to regulate acidity and stabilize pH in foods.

answers.q: how is ammonium adipate used in food
answers.a: It acts as an acidity regulator and buffering agent to control pH in products like powdered mixes, beverages, and processed foods. Where permitted, its use is regulated, and JECFA has set an ADI of 0–5 mg/kg body weight per day for adipic acid and its salts.
